conclusion: Analyze geometry of sphere and apply reflection and refraction properties.
Depicts glass sphere with right side silvered, light source S on axis of symmetry.
Light from source S reflects off surface and travels upwards, another part enters sphere and reflects back.
Silvered surface implies light entering and reflecting returns along same path.
Distance SM is path from light source S to top point M of sphere.
Geometry involves right triangle SMC with angle SCM = 60 degrees.
Using tangent, tan 60 degrees = SM/CM, and tan 60 degrees = sqrt(3).
Relationship between radius and tangent: CM = R/sqrt(3).
Substitute CM to find SM: SM = sqrt(3) * R/sqrt(3) = R.
Distance SM between light source S and top point M is radius R.
